snippet: After an archaeologist unearthed the remains of Albert Afraid of Hawk, a performer with Buffalo Bill, relatives planned to bury them in South Dakota.
abstract: Connecticut's state archeologist, Nicholas F Bellantonie, unearths the remains of Albert Afraid of Hawk, a Sioux Indian who died 112 years ago in Danbury, Conn as four of his family members look on in joy at the end of a long quest; they plan to bury his remains at the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation in South Dakota; Afraid of Hawk died at the age of 20 from botulism when traveling as a performer with Buffalo Bill's Wild West Show in Danbury.
lead_paragraph: After an archaeologist unearthed the remains of Albert Afraid of Hawk, a performer with Buffalo Bill, relatives planned to bury them in South Dakota.
